channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Andy Roddick says it doesn't matter if Trump was hit by bullet or sharpnel because...
item.description: ​Tennis legend Andy Roddick said it does not matter whether former president Donald Trump was hit by a bullet or a sharpnel as it does not change the fact that there was an assassination attempt on him. The comment came as FBI director Christopher Wray earlier this week expressed some doubt over what actually grazed Trump's right year at his rally in Pennsylvania. FBI, however, clarified later that Trump was injured by a bullet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Astrologer's 2020 post on Kamala running for President viral. 'Trump winning?' Internet asks her
item.description: ​A 2020 post by clairvoyant Amy Tripp, who goes by the name Starheal, has gone viral as in the post it was predicted that Kamala Harris will be running for the president post in 2024. "Kamala Harris will be 60 in 4 years. I see her running for Presidenyt in 2024 since this coincides with her Saturn return," the 2020 post read.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Usha Vance used to be appalled by Trump, it was surreal to see her next to him'
item.description: ​Usha Chilukuri Vance, the Indian-origin wife of senator JD Vance who could be the next vice president, used to be appalled by Donald Trump and it was surreal to see her next to Trump at the Republican National Convention, her old friends told Washington Post. Usha was registered as a Democrat almost a decade ago but was not vocal about politics. Her friends said she was actually repulsed by Trump after his January 6, 2021 action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 9 killed and several injured after rocket barrage from Lebanon struck Israel annexed Golan Heights
item.description: A rocket barrage from Lebanon killed nine and wounded 34, including 17 critically, in the Golan Heights. Israel blamed Hezbollah for the attack and is preparing a response. An Israeli airstrike on southern Lebanon killed three Hezbollah members, escalating tension. The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has intensified since the war in Gaza began after Hamas’ attack on October 7.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Disgusting': JD Vance on Jennifer Aniston's 'I pray your daughter...' remark
item.description: Ohio senator and Republican party's vice presidential candidate JD Vance said it's disgusting that a Hollywood celebrity commented on her two-year-old daughter and prayed that she should never face fertility problems. In the Megyn Kelly show where JD Vance defended her 'childless cat ladies' comment, without naming Jennifer Aniston, he said it was disgusting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Africa cancels visas of 95 Libyans detained at military-style camp
item.description: South Africa detained 95 Libyans at a camp in Mpumalanga, suspected to be an illicit military training base. Visas issued in Tunis were revoked, having been falsely acquired. The Libyans, originally allowed in for security guard training, have no clear affiliation, and the situation is under investigation, awaiting top officials' visit.

item.title: Kamala Harris focuses on 3 as potential V-P candidates
item.description: Kamala Harris has begun vetting potential running mates for her presidential bid, considering top Democratic figures like Mark Kelly, Josh Shapiro, and Tim Walz. Harris officially declared her candidacy, targeting a decision by August 7. Selecting a vice presidential candidate is crucial for her campaign as she challenges Republican nominee Donald Trump in the November election.

item.title: Trump tells Christians they won't have to vote after this election: 'We will have it fixed so good'. Watch
item.description: Donald Trump at a Friday event hosted by the conservative Christian organization Turning Point Action urged the Christians to vote -- and then he said they would not have to do it again because 'We'll have it fixed so good, you're not gonna have to vote'. “You won’t have to do it anymore. Four more years, you know what, it will be fixed, it will be fine, you won’t have to vote anymore, my beautiful Christians” Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: America's oldest person has this advice for long, healthy life: 'Don't hold...'
item.description: Elizabeth Francis, America's oldest person, turned 115 this week and fulfilled her heart's desire of having two slices of cake -- something she wished last year if she could make it to her 115th birthday. Her single tip on how to live a long and happy life is to 'speak your mind and don't hold your tongue'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Project Gaslight: Canada arrests 6 Punjabi youths over extortions targeting South Asian businesses
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: NYT opinion piece calls JD Vance 'purr-fectly dreadful', says Trump looks 'enlightened' now
item.description: JD Vance, the Ohio senator, who will be the running mate of former president Donald Trump in the November election, has been the man of the week for all wrong reasons. His derision towards 'childless cat ladies' -- an opinion that he expressed a few years ago and now laughed it off as satire enraged several Americans as JD Vance thinks adults without children and adults with children are different.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Big f*** you': Biden's quick endorsement of Kamala Harris is a 'message for Obama'
item.description: A day after the Obamas supported Kamala Harris as the presidential candidate for the Democratic party, reports claimed that President Joe Biden's quick endorsement of Kamala Harris was, in fact, a big 'f*** you' message to the prominent leaders of the party who wanted him out following the CNN debate -- and that included Barack Obama as well.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Blinken conveys concern to Wang over 'provocative actions' on Taiwan, US official says
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Chinese counterpart Wang Yi discussed Taiwan and Beijing's recent provocative actions, including a simulated blockade. They agreed to strengthen military ties. Blinken reiterated concerns over China's support for Russia, human rights issues in Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Tibet, and the need for progress on countering narcotics from China.

item.title: Why is '#CancelNetflix' trending on X and its surprising connection to US elections
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistani woman who wanted to marry third time murdered by her brothers: Report
item.description: In Karachi, a woman was allegedly murdered by her brothers after expressing her desire to remarry for the third time. She leaves behind eight children. Additionally, in Gul Town, another woman had her legs chopped off by her father and uncles for seeking a divorce from an abusive marriage. Both incidents are under police investigation.

item.title: Venezuela blocks Panama plane carrying senior politicians
item.description: A plane carrying former Latin American presidents ready to observe Venezuela's elections was grounded in Panama due to the blockade of Venezuelan airspace. The US warned Venezuelan President Maduro against interfering and hinted at adjusting sanctions based on the election outcome. Maduro, seeking a third term, faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia.

item.title: G20 agrees to work to effectively tax the superrich
Trump to rally in Minnesota, seeking to blunt Harris' campaign momentum
Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf organises rallies seeking release of jailed leader Imran Khan
item.description: The protests, organised at the provincial assembly level, saw local PTI lawmakers and leaders taking prominent roles in addressing the crowds. In Peshawar, demonstrations were conducted across all 13 provincial assembly constituencies, with a notable gathering in the Namak Mandi area led by Provincial Higher Education Minister Meena Khan Afridi.

item.title: Former vice president Mike Pence rejects Trump endorsement - Is he secretly backing Kamala Harris?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
